business.headline: Jewellery, coins, SGBs, ETFs: Why gold taxes differ so muchJewellery, coins, Sovereign Gold Bonds, gold ETFs, gold mutual funds, and digital gold may all mirror the same metal, yet each one produces a very different tax outcome. Read on to understand how gold taxation really works.

Capital gains tax was meant to be simpler. Here's why it feels harder nowSelling a long-held asset used to be a fairly predictable exercise. Inflation was factored in through indexation, the tax rate was known, and the final bill rarely came as a shock. That sense of certainty has faded.

What education sector wants from Budget 2026: Skills, quality and jobsWith India's youth population at the centre of its growth story, the education sector sees Budget 2026 as a chance to invest in better teachers, relevant skills and stronger pathways to jobs.

Tata Technologies' Q3 profit plunges 96% on one-time labour code chargeThe new labour rules, which came into effect in November, require employee wages to make up at least 50% of the total cost to company. Benefits such as provident fund and gratuity must now be calculated based on wages, raising costs for employers.

Gold and silver ETFs at record highs: Should you sell now or buy more?Gold and silver prices have climbed to record highs, pulling their ETFs up sharply as well. With returns looking attractive, investors are now facing a key question, i.e., is this the right time to book profits or stay invested? Let's have a look.

Will gold prices stay near record highs despite easing safe-haven demand?Gold prices are hovering near record highs even as some safe-haven demand fades, raising questions about whether support from interest rate cut expectations and global uncertainty will be enough to keep prices elevated.
Sensex, Nifty end higher driven by IT stocks; Infosys gains 6%The S&P BSE Sensex added 187.74 points to settle at 83,570.35, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 28.75 points to close at 25,694.35​​​​​​​.

Budget 2026: What India's middle class is really asking forWith Budget 2026 around the corner, India's middle class is hoping for relief that actually touches daily life, from jobs and inflation to housing and healthcare, so what is it really asking the government to deliver?

Are frequent market holidays holding India back as a global investment hub?In a post on X, Kamath said that shutting stock exchanges for a local municipal election shows poor planning, especially at a time when Indian markets have strong international linkages and global investor participation.

BCCL IPO listing date changed: Check new debut date, GMP and expected profitBCCL share price: Expectations around listing gains remain strong, as the grey market premium, or GMP, has moved higher. However, the stock's listing has been delayed, pushing the debut to a later date.

IMF likely to upgrade India's GDP forecast after Q3 growth exceeds expectationsIndia's third-quarter growth turned out to be better than expected. This has increased the chances of an upward revision in the IMF's outlook.

Can Budget 2026 address tax, talent and cost pressures in tourism and hospitality?Industry voices highlight the need for skilling reforms, tax incentives, and policy support to drive growth and innovation in India's tourism and hospitality sector.

Amagi Media Labs IPO: Should investors apply?Amagi Media Labs has stepped into the IPO market, drawing attention from investors keen on the fast-growing connected TV and streaming space. With positive brokerage views and steady grey market signals, the key question is whether the issue is worth subscribing to.

Infosys shares rally after Q3 FY26 results: Should you buy now?Infosys stock: The stock opened at Rs 1,670.30, touched an intraday high of Rs 1,683.45 and a low of Rs 1,654.55. The 52-week high of the stock stands at Rs 1,967.75, while the 52-week low is Rs 1,307.10.

Sensex jumps 700 points: Why is the stock market rising todayAt around 10:09 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 410.60 points at 83,793.31. The NSE Nifty50 also moved higher and was trading up 99.80 points at 25,765.40.

Infosys share price jumps 5%: Why is the IT stock rising todayInfosys reported deal wins worth $4.8 billion in the third quarter, a sharp jump from $3.1 billion in the previous quarter. Around 57% of these deals were classified as net new, indicating fresh business additions rather than renewals.
Sensex, Nifty rally as IT stocks jump in early trade; Infosys gains 5%The S&P BSE Sensex added 358.23 points to 83,740.94, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 87.55 points to 25,753.25 as of 9:54 am.

TCS headcount dips sharply: Why is India's IT sector facing a job crisisAt the end of Q3 FY26, Tata Consultancy Services said its total headcount stood at 582,163, down by 11,151 employees from 593,314 at the end of the September quarter.

Sensex, Nifty today: Stock markets likely to open higher. Here's why?Market participants are now waiting for earnings announcements from other large companies. Results from firms such as Reliance Industries, Wipro, HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank are expected later on Friday and on Saturday.
Not so 'strait': Hormuz, Iran, and the global oil tradeAround 84 per cent of the crude oil and condensate transported through this strait goes to Asian markets.

entertainment.headline: Dhurandhar 2 will be biggest multi-starrer in the history of cinema: Ram Gopal Varma Director Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar 2, inspired by major real-life events, is set for a March 19 release. Ahead of that, filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma praised the film, stating it would be a great milestone for Bollywood.

Akshaye Khanna set to return in Race 4? Producer Ramesh Taurani addresses rumour Producer Ramesh Taurani has clarified that Akshaye Khanna will not be returning for the upcoming fourth instalment of the Race franchise, putting an end to ongoing speculation about the cast.

Aasif Sheikh, Ravi Kishan escape near-fatal accident on Bhabiji Ghar Par Hain set Aasif Sheikh and Ravi Kishan recount a close call on set when a large tree fell between them on the first day of shooting, leaving cast and crew shaken but unharmed. The incident occurred during the filming of Bhabiji Ghar Par Hain! – Fun on the Run, set to release in cinemas on February 6, 2026.

Japanese fan breaks down as Allu Arjun recognises her in Tokyo. Video Actor Allu Arjun is in Tokyo with his family to promote the Japan release of Pushpa 2: The Rule, where a touching moment with a Japanese fan drew attention online.

Mrunal Thakur's cryptic post amid wedding rumours with Dhanush Recent speculation about Mrunal Thakur and Dhanush planning a wedding in February 2026 has been firmly denied by sources close to the actors. Amid the rumours, Mrunal shared a calm post on Instagram.

Govinda calls rift rumours a big conspiracy, breaks silence on Sunita's remarks Amid months of speculation about his marriage, Govinda has spoken publicly, addressing concerns about his family and revealing he believes they are unknowingly involved in what he calls a 'big conspiracy.'

Bigg Boss Kannada 12 grand finale live: Mutant Raghu eliminated Bigg Boss Kannada season 12 grand finale saw its first set of eliminations with Dhanush and Raghu exiting the house. Ashwini Gowda, Gilli Nata, Rakshita Shetty and Kavya Shaiva remain in competition.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9 grand finale live: Aurora Sinclair eliminated, is 3rd runner-up Bigg Boss Tamil 9 finale live updates: The grand finale of Vijay Sethupathi-hosted Bigg Boss Tamil 9 is all set to begin at 6 pm today. Divya Ganesan, Aurora Sinclair, Sabarinathan and Vikram are the finalists who are fighting for the trophy.

Nora Fatehi breaks silence on Bhushan Kumar affair rumours Actor-dancer Nora Fatehi responds to revived social media rumours linking her to T-Series chairman Bhushan Kumar, following a TikTok post referencing a five-year-old Reddit thread.

Rajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa reveal baby girl's name, share first photo Actors Rajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa have publicly introduced their newborn daughter, Parvati Paul Rao, through an Instagram post. The announcement, which included a message and a family photograph, has prompted congratulatory responses from fellow actors and fans.

Grateful to India: AR Rahman sings different tune after calling Bollywood communal Music composer AR Rahman has issued a public statement following criticism of his recent interview, reiterating his dedication to India and clarifying the intent behind his remarks.

Actor Kalyan Ram mobbed while paying tribute to grandfather NTR. Watch Actor Kalyanram Nandamuri visited NTR Ghat in Hyderabad before sunrise on Sunday to pay homage to his grandfather, Nandamuri Taraka Rama Rao, with fans gathering in significant numbers despite the early hour.

Why Karan Johar broke down while working with Salman Khan on Kuch Kuch Hota Hai Karan Johar recounts his emotional first day directing Salman Khan on the set of Kuch Kuch Hota Hai, sharing insights into the film's enduring popularity and the behind-the-scenes moments that shaped its legacy.

Chinmayi defends AR Rahman amid Vande Mataram claim; Meerra weighs in Music composer AR Rahman has come under scrutiny after comments made in a recent interview, resulting in criticism on social media. Singer Chinmayi Sripada and actor Meerra Chopraa have taken to online platforms to defend him.

She-llain rising: The Bollywood bad girl is turning disturbingly real The female villain gets a darker edge with the current crop like Amma in Mardaani 3 and Badi Didi in Delhi Crime 3. But does today's uncomfortably real she-llain owe her origin to vamps of yore? Read on.

Did you know Bridgerton actor Luke Thompson is quarter Indian? Actor Luke Thompson, known for his role as Benedict in Bridgerton, has shared that he is a quarter Indian, citing his grandmother's heritage.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9 grand finale countdown: 4 finalists and a season of ugly fights The grand finale of Bigg Boss Tamil 9 is set to air on Vijay Television and JioHotstar on January 18. Vijay Sethupathi hosted the show this season that kickstarted on October 5.

Refused to meet me: Kangana recalls her AR Rahman experience during Emergency Bollywood actor Kangana Ranaut has publicly criticised composer AR Rahman for declining to meet her regarding her directorial film Emergency, alleging prejudice and partiality.

Don 3 casting rumours debunked as insiders deny Atlee, Hrithik Roshan link Speculation regarding the involvement of director Atlee and actor Hrithik Roshan in Don 3 has been dismissed by sources close to the project.

general news.headline: US tariffs risk downward spiral: European nations express solidarity with GreenlandTrump on Saturday announced a 10 per cent tariff would be imposed on imports from Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, Germany, the UK, the Netherlands and Finland from February 1, 2026.

They are playing their shots and giving it a proper chase in Indore. Could there be a miracle on the cards?

He was begging for help: Delivery agent who tried to rescue drowning techieA delivery agent risked his life and tried to rescue a 27-year-old software engineer, who drowned after his car plunged into a drain amid dense fog. While he heard cries for his help, he was unable to locate him.

Thinking of studying in Ireland? Indian students share brutal realityHandcrafted ByOur Editors Thousands of Indian students arrived in Ireland chasing a dream, but what they found was nothing like they expected. Every step forward seems to come with a new, unseen hurdle. Why does the Irish dream feel more like a nightmare? Students share the harsh truth.

5,000 killed in Iran protests; Tehran says terrorists, rioters targeted innocentsThe unrest, the deadliest since the 1979 revolution, was most severe in Kurdish regions, and has largely subsided following a heavy security crackdown and internet shutdowns.

Has Rohit Sharma played his last for India? Fans upset after Indore ODI failureIndia vs New Zealand: Star Indian opener Rohit Sharma struggled throughout the ODI series against New Zealand, failing to score a half-century. Rohit was dismissed for 11 in the series decider in Indore.

Did US force India to pull out of Iran's Chabahar port? How big is the loss?A report about India's strategic withdrawal from Iran's Chabahar port triggered a political slugfest between the Congress and the BJP. Experts suggest the Chabahar story is less about an exit and more about managing strategic ambition under Trump sanctions.

Is friendflation making us lonely?With the prices of everything increasing, young Indians are finding that inflation is not only making daily life difficult but forcing many to cut back on socialising and reshaping friendships. Here is how young people in urban India are navigating friendflation, and what experts suggest could help in such situations.

Winter chill set to intensify in North India on Monday, dense fog likelyNorth India is preparing for a significant drop in temperature as two western disturbances approach the region in quick succession. Experts suggest a surge in the winter chill across Delhi, Punjab, and Uttar Pradesh alongside dense fog warnings.

Trump's new 'Board of Peace' comes with $1 billion price tag for permanent seatsUS President Donald Trump's proposed Board of Peace is taking shape, with Gaza as its first focus and global ambitions beyond. A draft charter shows nations may need to pay $1 billion to secure permanent membership, as per a Bloomberg report.
A day in the life of Bharat Taxi rider, what it's like in a cooperative cabWith 296% growth in two weeks, the government-backed service is booming on paper—but what is it like on the road?

2026's biggest lifestyle shift? Living life on analog modeOn Instagram, a new trend is emerging: people are sharing their analog journeys - replacing digital habits with physical, hands-on experiences.

An Se Young, the queen of badminton, retains her Delhi throneRetaining her title in a mere 43 minutes, An Se-young turned the India Open final into a showcase of invincibility. By handing Wang Zhi-yi a 10th straight defeat, the South Korean star secured her sixth title on the trot, proving once again that the gap between the World No. 1 and the rest is a chasm.

Vote for BJP to stop Sandeshkhali-like incidents: PM jabs Trinamool in SingurAddressing a poll rally in Bengal's Singur on Sunday, the Prime Minister alleged that law and order and education have deteriorated under the Trinamool government.

Macron's 'tiger's gaze': Why internet thinks there's more than meet the eyeFrench President Emmanuel Macron's recent public appearance with a bloodshot eye and sunglasses led to widespread social media discussion and revived scrutiny of online harassment targeting his wife Brigitte Macron.

Watch: Astro Shux reveals what he carried to the International Space StationGroup Captain Shubhanshu Shukla carried the Dharohar Deck to the International Space Station, a bridge between Earth's ancient looms and the final frontier.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12 grand finale live: Mutant Raghu eliminatedBigg Boss Kannada season 12 grand finale saw its first set of eliminations with Dhanush and Raghu exiting the house. Ashwini Gowda, Gilli Nata, Rakshita Shetty and Kavya Shaiva remain in competition.

Umar Khalid has right to speedy trial, bail should be the rule: DY ChandrachudAt the Jaipur Literature Festival, former CJI DY Chandrachud addressed concerns around Umar Khalid's prolonged detention, stressing that the right to a speedy trial is part of Article 21. He argued that unless strict exceptions apply, bail must remain the constitutional norm.

Pakistan activist's SOS after TLP death threats for saving Hindu girlsAn SOS from a Hindu rights activist from Pakistan's Sindh has revealed that speaking up against forced conversions of minor Hindu girls can attract death in Pakistan. Shiva Kachhi has alleged that the banned Islamist group TLP has issued fatwa threats against him for speaking against forced conversions and the government was simply looking away.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9 grand finale live: Aurora Sinclair eliminated, is 3rd runner-upBigg Boss Tamil 9 finale live updates: The grand finale of Vijay Sethupathi-hosted Bigg Boss Tamil 9 is all set to begin at 6 pm today. Divya Ganesan, Aurora Sinclair, Sabarinathan and Vikram are the finalists who are fighting for the trophy.

On hold: EU freezes trade pact with US after Trump's tariff over Greenland demandThe European Parliament has halted the US-EU trade deal ratification after Donald Trump imposed new Greenland-linked tariffs. Lawmakers warned that the zero-tariff pact cannot proceed and that they would prepare possible countermeasures under the anti-coercion rules.

Noida techie dies screaming for help after car plunges into 30-foot drainA 27-year-old man died after his speeding car went out of control, broke a drain boundary, and plunged into a water-filled basement near Sector-150 in Greater Noida.

sports.headline: What went wrong? R Ashwin analyses Shubman Gill's technical flaw after Indore failure IND vs NZ: Shubman Gill's early exit in the Indore decider put the spotlight on his technique, with Ravichandran Ashwin explaining how a brief loss of alignment between bat and pad proved costly against Kyle Jamieson.

AUS Open: Zeynep Sonmez rushes to help ball girl after fainting, wins hearts Turkish qualifier Zeynep Sonmez paused her opening-round match at the Australian Open to help a fainting ball girl, before securing a three-set win on Sunday, January 18. Sonmez created history with her win, but it was her selfless act that won hearts of the fans.

Day 2 Schedule: Novak Djokovic, Coco Gauff, Iga Swiatek begin campaign Day 2 of the 2026 Australian Open features top stars like Novak Djokovic, Iga Swiatek, and Coco Gauff beginning their campaigns, with rising challengers ready to make an impact.

Has Rohit Sharma played his last for India? Fans upset after Indore ODI failure India vs New Zealand: Star Indian opener Rohit Sharma struggled throughout the ODI series against New Zealand, failing to score a half-century. Rohit was dismissed for 11 in the series decider in Indore.

England face curfews for T20 World Cup, Sri Lanka tour after Ashes incident: Report England have imposed a midnight curfew on players after the Ashes and New Zealand tour controversies, tightening discipline ahead of the Sri Lanka series and T20 World Cup following several alcohol-related incidents.

Carlos Alcaraz crushes Adam Walton, Emma Raducanu makes dominating start Carlos Alcaraz and Emma Raducanu both made strong starts at the 2026 Australian Open, advancing to the second round with dominant performances at Melbourne Park

25-second timer to continue at Indonesia Masters amid mixed player views As the Badminton World Federation continues trials of its 25-second shot clock, players and coaches are divided over its impact on match flow and fairness.

Mitchell–Phillips mayhem: Record partnership leaves India stunned in 3rd ODI Daryl Mitchell and Glenn Phillips tormented India with a record stand to stun the hosts at the Holkar stadium during the 3rd ODI on Sunday, January 18. Mitchell and Phillips scored hundreds to save the Blackcaps innings and lay the foundation for a strong total.

Back at No.5, Glenn Phillips punishes India with 83-ball hundred in Indore IND vs NZ, 3rd ODI: Glenn Phillips thrived at No.5 with a superb 83-ball hundred in Indore, combining patience and power to punish India as his 219-run stand with Daryl Mitchell swung the ODI decisively.

Venus Williams left heartbroken as Olga Danilovic scripts unreal comeback in Round 1 Venus Williams was close to making history as the oldest player to win at the Australian Open. But Olga Danilovic's remarkable comeback denied her the record on Sunday at the John Cain Arena.

An Se Young, the queen of badminton, retains her Delhi throne Retaining her title in a mere 43 minutes, An Se-young turned the India Open final into a showcase of invincibility. By handing Wang Zhi-yi a 10th straight defeat, the South Korean star secured her sixth title on the trot, proving once again that the gap between the World No. 1 and the rest is a chasm.

Daryl Mitchell boosts No.1 ODI hopes with back-to-back centuries vs IndiaIndia vs New Zealand: Star New Zealand batter Daryl Mitchell once again came to New Zealand's rescue, slamming his second successive and fourth overall ODI hundred against the Shubman Gill-led India in Raipur.

Fangirl Sabalenka clicks selfie with Federer, Laver after gritty Aus Open openerAryna Sabalenka had a fangirl moment with Roger Federer and Rod Laver as she clicked a selfie with the tennis legends after her gritty first round win on Sunday, January 18. Sabalenka defeated Tiantsoa Rakotomanga Rajaonah to make it to the second round.

I would cry every day in front of my dad: Harshit Rana on overcoming failureHarshit Rana shared how he used to handle failure and the role his father played in helping him overcome adversity during his early days. Harshit has found himself to be a favourite of India coach Gautam Gambhir.

Steve Smith breaks silence on Babar Azam fallout rumours in BBL | WatchAustralia batter Steve Smith on Sunday played down reports of a rift with Pakistan's Babar Azam following their on-field exchange in the Sixers' BBL game against Sydney Thunder.

Tata Steel Chess: Erigaisi beats Praggnanandhaa, Gukesh draws in opening roundArjun Erigaisi secured a swift victory over Praggnanandhaa while D Gukesh settled for a lengthy draw against Javokhir Sindarov as the Tata Steel Masters opened with upsets and strong performances. Keymer and Niemann also emerged victorious, sharing the early lead as the first round featured decisive play and high-profile draws.

T20 World Cup: England's Pakistan-origin players receive visas, others to get soonThe International Cricket Council (ICC) is facilitating visa formalities for 42 players and officials of Pakistani origin ahead of the T20 World Cup in India. The move is aimed at ensuring their smooth participation in the tournament, despite the additional scrutiny typically faced by visa applicants of Pakistani origin travelling to India.

Arshdeep Singh returns for series-deciding ODI after social media backlashIndia vs New Zealand: Arshdeep Singh returned to the Indian playing XI as captain Shubman Gill won the toss and opted to bowl against New Zealand in the third and final ODI in Indore.

Arthur Fery stuns 20th seed Cobolli to make his mum's marathon trip worthwhileAustralian Open: Qualifier Arthur Fery produced a stunning upset on Sunday, defeating 20th seed Flavio Cobolli to ensure his mother's long journey from Britain was rewarded with at least another match to watch him play in Melbourne.

Long queues frustrate fans as ticket sales halted on opening dayAustralian Open organisers came under fire on the tournament's opening day on Sunday (January 18, 2026), as frustrated fans endured long queues outside Melbourne Park and complained of confusion following the sudden suspension of ticket sales.

Ayush Badoni grateful for maiden India call-up: Have been working hard on bowlingIndia vs New Zealand: Ayush Badoni credits his decision to take up bowling a couple of years ago for transforming him into an all-rounder, which helped him secure his maiden India call-up.

Rohit Sharma's piece of advice that Harshit Rana will never forget, video goes viralHarshit Rana's 4/39 in the Sydney ODI silenced critics, but it was Rohit Sharma's simple on-field advice — leading to an instant wicket — that left a lasting impression and has since gone viral.

India tough place to play: Phillips plays down history talk ahead of final ODINew Zealand batter Glenn Phillips admitted the prospect of scripting another chapter of history in India was "pretty cool" but insisted his side would lean on process and adaptability rather than emotion as they chase a rare white-ball series win against a formidable host.

3rd ODI live: Virat Kohli, Harshit Rana refuse to bow out in IndoreIndia (IND) vs New Zealand (NZ) live score 3rd ODI: India (206/6 in 37 ov). Ravindra Jadeja's brain-fade moment has resulted in India losing their 6th wicket of the night. Virat Kohli is slowly running out of partners as India chase 338 in the series decider.

The U19 World Cup promise: How many teen stars graduated to Team India?As the 2026 U19 World Cup unfolds, a look at how the tournament became Indian cricket's proving ground—and how many teenage sensations survived its glare to earn lasting India caps.

Smriti Mandhana falls prey to WPL's 90s curse, guides RCB to 4th successive winSmriti Mandhana scored 96 as RCB defeated Delhi Capitals by eight wickets in WPL 2026. The century curse continues in the tournament, with no player yet reaching three figures, despite the tournament being in its fourth season.

Vaishnavi gets maiden ODI call up for Australia tour, Harleen dropped from T20IsVaishnavi Sharma and Bharti Fulmali have been named in India's squads for the Australia tour starting February 15. However, Harleen Deol has been dropped from the T20I setup, following her underwhelming returns in shortest format so far.

Australian Open: Sabalenka top favourite, but can Swiatek, Gauff take down the giant?Aryna Sabalenka enters the Australian Open as the favourite, but Madison Keys, Amanda Anisimova, Iga Swiatek, and Coco Gauff are all strong contenders capable of challenging her.

AUS Open Day 1  Highlights: Williams loses vs Danilovic, Alcaraz, Raducanu into Round 2Australian Open 2026  Highlights: Venus Williams crashed out after losing to Olga Danilovic in the first round. But Carlos Alcaraz and Emma Raducanu registered their berths in the second round of the hard-court major.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
